basics.name: Jim Peters
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary:
Recovering-attorney-turned-software-developer who took advantage of Covid-19 to make a long-overdue career change into tech. Problem-solving, puzzles, and figuring out how things work are some of my favorite things.

Although my formal coding training is recent, I have spent my entire life 'tinkering' with electronics, teaching myself programming languages and developing various projects to make life easier. I have always prided myself on my ability to quickly pick up a language, program or concept.

work.summary: After training Brazilian Jiu Jitsu for over nine years, I was selected from hundreds of students to become an instructor.

highlights: Handled all manner of cases in pre-litigation, litigation and before administrative bodies
Coded and maintained Wordpress corporate website from scratch
Fully customized and maintained Time Matters case management server and software, running on MySQL server
Advised management, employees, human resources professionals and union on how best to proceed in disputes
Researched, installed, customized and oversaw migration to Time Matters case management software, including writing a manual on how to enter data according to firm policies.
Wrote for weekly Orange County Register column answering employment law questions for readers
Taught a course at Western State University College of Law on wage & hour law
Supervised staff of approximately ten law clerks and paralegals
Oversaw extensive hardware and software upgrades, including upgrade to case management database and analytics software.

courses: Received the highest grade available ('Exceeds Expectations') on all ten assigned projects.
American Jurisprudence Awards in Tax Law Research and Bankruptcy Law Courses

projects.name: Miss Direction
projects.description: A mapping engine that misguides you
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript
